scripts.__dev_comment__: Configure dev env with babel-node and node-dev (or nodemon if nodemon isn't broken): https://github.com/babel/example-node-server. UPDATE: In Babel 7, the 'babel-node' command comes from @babel/node: https://new.babeljs.io/docs/en/next/v7-migration.html#babel-node. If node-dev doesn't work in dev:express, then use PM2's watch and restart options for development: https://pm2.io/doc/en/runtime/guide/development-tools/#watch-options.
scripts.__build_comment__: Configure production build with babel (https://github.com/babel/example-node-server), but use the new @babel/cli package (https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-cli)
scripts.postbuild: echo Build Complete! Now run: npm run prod
scripts.__prod_comment__: After building your app for production, run 'npm run prod' to start the Node server and run your app in production mode
scripts.__buildprod_comment__: The buildprod command is a combination of the 'build' command and the 'prod' command.
scripts.__clean_comment__: 'rimraf' is the UNIX command 'rm -rf' for Node.
scripts.__lint_comment__: This will run ESLint against anything in our src folder with the file extension .js or .vue.
scripts.__comment__: Do I still need the following linting scripts? I need to test them and see if they do anything differently than the one above.
scripts.posttest: echo The test suite is complete!
